intro: Jasione ateridae, commonly known as the dark violet, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its dark purple to almost black flowers, which bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is native to regions in southern Europe and western Asia. Jasione ateridae has small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and unique coloration.
